2.2	Consistent with OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM), the Boars Head Refrigeration Supervisor has assisted in the development of these regulatory programs and has overall responsibility for program implementation with support from facility and corporate personnel.

1.2.3	As a result of a recognized highly toxic chemical used at Boars Head, the facility has developed and implemented Prevention Program 3 in accordance with EPAs Risk Management Program.  Also in place at the Boars Head facility is a Process Safety Management program as required by OSHA Standard 29 CFR1910.119.  

1.3	Worst/Alternate Case Release Scenarios

1.3.1	Although engineering controls incorporated into the refrigeration process would normally prevent such releases, the possibility of a catastrophic release does exist. Based on that premise, the facility has modeled two off site consequence analyses; a worst case scenario and an alternate case scenario. 

1.3.2	For all scenarios, EPAs ALOHA and MARPLOT software was used to determine Off-Site Consequence Analysis.  The distance to toxic endpoint for such a release and potential receptors are discussed in Section 3.2 and shown on imbedded maps within this document.  


1.4	Emergency Action and Response Program

1.4.1	Boars Head is equipped with an emergency warning system.  Alarms are strategically placed throughout the facility to alarm personnel of an emergency relating to the accidental release of anhydrous ammonia or other emergencies that may be encountered.  There are specified procedures that all employees will follow in the event of release.  These procedures can be found in the ONE Plan on file at the facility.  These procedures include immediate notification to authorities and evacuation of facility personnel.

1.1.3	Boars Heads aim is to provide a professional service as efficiently as possible while minimizing the use of toxic materials where ever and whenever possible.  In this effort our highest priority will be the proactive pursuit of cost-effective process changes that reduce or eliminate the use and/or generation of hazardous toxics at the endpoint of service.  Where hazardous toxics cannot be eliminated, improving controls to handle these substances will be explored and implemented whenever and wherever possible. 

1.1.4	Boars Head has prepared a safety policy and procedures program specifically tailored for the facility in addition to establishing a Process Safety Management Program.  It is the responsibility of the facilitys management personnel to carry out these programs. 

1.1.5	The first duty of Boars Head employees is to exercise care in the performance of their work tasks to prevent an accident to themselves, co-workers, the general public or equipment.  Safety-consciousness must take precedent over expedience and is required as a condition of continued employment of all employees at all levels of the organization.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

 SUMMARY: 
This document has been prepared to demonstrate how Boars Head Provisions Co., Inc. complies with requirements set forth under EPAs Chemical Accidental Prevention Provisions (40 CFR 68).   This plan was developed specifically to address the requirements applicable to the use of anhydrous ammonia at the Boars Head New Castle South facility located in New Castle, Indiana.  Each of the following sections provides a general overview of the facility requirements and defines design attributes, documentation, and actions that are established to comply with those requirements. Boars Head has already developed measures and systems that provide compliance with 40 CFR Part 68 rules as a results of other regulatory programs and requirements.  This document does not replicate that information but rather provides cross-references to the applicable existing documents.  In those instances, where information was developed specifically to comply with Part 68 requirements, that information is contained in that document.  

1.1 Commitment to Safety
The health and safety of our partners, contractors and visitors is the most important aspect of our operations which include the protection of the environment and our surrounding communities. Our commitment to safety is more than words; it is the core value we live and work by at Boars Head Provisions Company, Inc. The success of our safety culture and environmental commitment is based on our belief that every partner must and will be actively engaged both in safety and the protection of the environment.  

1.1.1	It is the policy of Boars Head to: 
1.1.1.1	Provide safe working conditions, proper tools and personal protective equipment. 

1.1.1.2	Comply with all federal, state and local occupational health and safety laws and regulations. 
1.1.1.3	Provide and sustain a high level of commitment to ensuring that all employees have a safe and healthy work environment in which to work.
